channel.title: -How do i make safe zones, and wildy zones etc-
channel.description: Well i've been following tutorials on how to add safe zones and wildy zones etc, some of them worked, some didn't can someone pelase explain and tell me where to find it and the correct coding, thanks much appreciated.

item.dc:creator: @Goth_Wolf Goth Wolf
item.description:
@Goth_Wolf wrote:

* ________ |---------| |---------| |---------| |________| *

Thats wrong sides it’s south west corner and north east [br][br][size=1]Posted on: January 02, 2009, 03:10:41 am[/size][hr]|| (absX >= southwestx && absX <= northeastx && absY >= southwesty && absY <= northeasty)

item.title: -How do i make safe zones, and wildy zones etc-
item.dc:creator: @xx_qwertyuiop_xx xx qwertyuiop xx
item.description:
@xx_qwertyuiop_xx wrote:

You call it with the min and max x and y coordinates and if the player is standing within those coordinates it returns true.

if(isWithin(980, 1221, 2000, 2121) || etc.)

item.title: -How do i make safe zones, and wildy zones etc-
item.dc:creator: @r34p4g3pk r34p4g3pk
item.description:
@r34p4g3pk wrote:

I’m gonna try qwerty’s way aswell, waht do i do with the following?

private final boolean isWithin(int minX, int maxX, int minY, int maxY) { return absX >= minX && absX <= maxX && absY >= minY && absY <= maxY; }

Do i do the same thing i did with kitten’s way, or something different, and i mean the coordinates.

Read full topic

item.title: -How do i make safe zones, and wildy zones etc-
item.dc:creator: @xx_qwertyuiop_xx xx qwertyuiop xx
item.description:
@xx_qwertyuiop_xx wrote:

r34p4g3pk:

What is that for?

It’s a method to check whether a player is within a specified area.

KittenCake:

np. and to qwerty, im not saying theres not better ways, thats just my way.

That’s the way most people do it, actually.
It’s extremely messy and the method I suggested is much better.

Read full topic

item.title: -How do i make safe zones, and wildy zones etc-
item.dc:creator: @xx_qwertyuiop_xx xx qwertyuiop xx
item.description:
@xx_qwertyuiop_xx wrote:

[quote=“xx qwertyuiop xx, post:3, topic:254050”]That > and < crap is pretty repetitive, especially in the nonWild method. You should make a method for that.

private final boolean isWithin(int minX, int maxX, int minY, int maxY) { return absX >= minX && absX <= maxX && absY >= minY && absY <= maxY; } [/quote]

Read full topic

item.description:
@KittenCake wrote:

yes, that would make the entire box a safe zone… so it would be

UNSAFE UNSAFE UNSAFE
UNSAFE _______ UNSAFE
UNSAFE |SAFE—| UNSAFE
UNSAFE |SAFE—| UNSAFE
UNSAFE |SAFE—| UNSAFE
UNSAFE |_______| UNSAFE
UNSAFE UNSAFE UNSAFE

item.title: -How do i make safe zones, and wildy zones etc-
item.dc:creator: @KittenCake KittenCake
item.description:
@KittenCake wrote:

so lets say this little box

---------
---------
________

was wild, and you wanted to make it non wild… you would need to go to the stars/ asterisks

---------
---------
________ 
              *

and find out the x and y coords… in this case, the top stars coords are X- 1221 and y 2121 and the bottom stars coords are
X 980 and Y 2000, you would put
|| (absX >= 980 && absX <= 1221 && absY >= 2000 && absY <= 2121)
under public boolean nonWild() {

Read full topic
item.source: -How do i make safe zones, and wildy zones etc-

item.title: -How do i make safe zones, and wildy zones etc-
item.dc:creator: @r34p4g3pk r34p4g3pk
item.description:
@r34p4g3pk wrote:

Alright, so i got to a bunch of safe areas, now i don’t get the form of it, like this:

		|| (absX >= 3545 && absX <= 3552 && absY >= 3550 && absY <= 3557)

Could you maybe explain it a little better, does it mean like 3545 as the starting x coordinate of the safe zone, 3552 as the ending x coordinate of the safe zone, 3550 as the starting y coordinate of the safe zone, and 3557 as the ending y coordinate of the same zone, am i correct, please correct me if i’m wrong.

Read full topic
item.source: -How do i make safe zones, and wildy zones etc-

item.title: -How do i make safe zones, and wildy zones etc-
item.dc:creator: @KittenCake KittenCake
item.description:
@KittenCake wrote:

to make it non wild, search up “public boolean nonWild() {” without the quotations, get the coords you want the wild zone to expand from and put it in a form like this
|| (absX >= 2542 && absX <= 2603 && absY >= 3925 && absY <= 3933)
absX is the x coordinates, absY is the y coordinates, so it would expand from X- 2542 Y-3925 to X- 2603 Y-3933

Read full topic
